TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit MinMaxParagraphWidth extends System.ValueType implements class System.IEquatable`1<valuetype System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.MinMaxParagraphWidth>

Docs.summary: Represents the smallest and largest possible paragraph width that can fully contain the specified text content.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.MinMaxParagraphWidth.MinWidth%2A> property to generate the minimum paragraph width for the formatted lines of text.
[!code-vb[TextFormattingSnippets#TextFormattingSnippet3](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/textformattingsnippets/window1.xaml.vb#textformattingsnippet3)] [!code-cs[TextFormattingSnippets#TextFormattingSnippet3](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/TextFormattingSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#textformattingsnippet3)]

Docs.returns: `true` if is equal to the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"> object; otherwise, `false`. If is not a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"> object, `false` is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Serves as a hash function for <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference">. It is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
Docs.returns: An <see cref="T:System.Int32"> value that represents the hash code for the current object.

Docs.summary: Gets the largest paragraph width possible that can fully contain the specified text content.
Docs.value: A <see cref="T:System.Double"> that represents the largest paragraph width possible.

Docs.summary: Gets the smallest paragraph width possible that can fully contain the specified text content.
Docs.value: A <see cref="T:System.Double"> that represents the smallest paragraph width possible.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The minimum paragraph width corresponds to the word that has the greatest width in the text content.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the MinWidth property to generate the minimum paragraph width for the formatted lines of text.
[!code-vb[TextFormattingSnippets#TextFormattingSnippet3](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/textformattingsnippets/window1.xaml.vb#textformattingsnippet3)] [!code-cs[TextFormattingSnippets#TextFormattingSnippet3](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/TextFormattingSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#textformattingsnippet3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The objects are equal if their <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.MinMaxParagraphWidth.MinWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.MinMaxParagraphWidth.MaxWidth%2A> properties are equal.
